column3: 2015. local florists send gifts james jim t. clark
column9: at the warsaw health and rehabilitation center in warsaw. he was born on december 29
column11: in canton. jim was one of eleven children born to earl and bess baker clark. he was a graduate of canton high school and a 1961 graduate of the university of columbia. jim served his country in the united states air force. he retired from the seafood department at walmart in sedalia. jim was a faithful member of calvary baptist church in sedalia. his faith was a big part of his life. he could recite most any verse
column13: out of the bible. he liked to travel. he enjoyed living in different places. which gave him the opportunity to meet different people and allowed him to experience many things. jim is survived by one son
column14: jeff clark and jeverne of raytown; two daughters
column15: kim foreman and jeff of stover and melissa lang and eric of haughton
column18: jasmine foreman and significant other austin
column20: and justis foreman; one great grandchild
column22: joe clark and mary ellen of canton; and four sisters
column29: he was preceded in death by a still born sibling; two brothers
column30: clifford and wane clark; and two sisters
column31: marjorie selb and margurite entzeroth. the family will receive friends from 2:00 until 2:30 p. m. saturday
column33: 2015 at the calvary baptist church in sedalia. memorial services will be at 2:30 p. m. saturday
column36: with pastor ted francis officiating. in keeping with his wishes
column37: he was cremated with inurnment at a later date in crown hill cemetery
column38: calvary cemetery addition. memorial contributions are suggested to michael j. fox foundation for parkinsons research. send sympathy card print name location email personal message hide emailenter personal message here too difficult to read? reload. type the text in order submit guest book entry .
